StoredProcedureSqlServerv2k5.name: [InsertUpdateContactCardAddress]
StoredProcedureSqlServerv2k5.body:
@ID uniqueiden..er, @Street1 varchar(200)= NULL, @Street2 varchar(200)= NULL, @City varchar(50)= NULL, @County varchar(20)= NULL, @State varchar(2)= NULL, @Zip varchar(10)= NULL, @Phone varchar(15)= NULL, @CityCode varchar(4) = null, @CountyCode varchar(3) = null, @StateCode varchar(2) = null
AS BEGIN
-- STEP 1: Start the transac.on BEGIN TRANSACTION -- STEP 2 & 3: Issue the data change statement(s), checking @@ERROR a.er each statement
IF EXISTS(SELECT ID FROM ContactCardAddress WHERE ID = @ID) BEGIN UPDATE [usmc].ContactCardAddress SET Street1 = @Street1, Street2= @Street2, City = @City, County= @County, State = @State, Zip = @Zip, Phone= @Phone, City_Code = @CityCode, COUNTY_CODE = @CountyCode, STATE_CODE = @StateCode WHERE ID=@ID
END ELSE BEGIN
INSERT INTO [usmc].ContactCardAddress (ID, Street1, Street2, City, County, State , Zip, Phone, CITY_CODE, COUNTY_CODE, STATE_CODE) VALUES (@ID, @Street1, @Street2, @City, @County , @State, @Zip, @Phone, @CityCode, @CountyCode, @StateCode)
END
-- Rollback the transac.on if there were any errors IF @@ERROR <> 0 BEGIN -- Rollback the transac.on ROLLBACK TRANSACTION
-- Raise an error and return RAISERROR ('Error occurred while performing the change.', 16, 1) RETURN END
-- Rollback the transac.on if the number of rows changed does not meet our expecta.on... IF @@ROWCOUNT > 1 BEGIN -- Rollback the transac.on ROLLBACK TRANSACTION
-- Raise an error and return RAISERROR ('An unexpected number of rows were changed.', 16, 1) RETURN END
-- STEP 4: If we reach this point, the commands completed successfully -- Commit the transac.on.... COMMIT TRANSACTION
END
